Pre-Game Insights: The Pakistan vs New Zealand T20 series starts on April 18th, 2024 in Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.
Pakistan won the previous five-match T20 series against New Zealand 4-1 in April 2023.
The series is seen as ideal preparation for both teams ahead of the T20 World Cup in June 2024.
Shaheen Afridi was replaced as captain due to poor performances.
Babar Azam has returned as captain under the new PCB management led by chairman Mohsin Naqvi.
Muhammad Amir and Imad Wasim have returned to the national team after long gaps.
New Zealand will miss key players due to IPL commitments, including Kane Williamson, Devon Conway, Daryl Mitchell, Rachin Ravindra, Mitchell Santner, Lockie Ferguson, Trent Boult, and Glenn Philipps.
Will Young, Tom Latham, and Tim Southee will also be unavailable due to personal commitments.
Michael Bracewell has been appointed as the captain of the New Zealand team for the series.
Others: The schedule for the Pakistan vs New Zealand T20 series includes matches on April 18, April 20, April 21, April 25, and April 27, 2024.
